noun.description: Each of a pair of globular organs in the head through which people and vertebrate animals see, the visible part typically appearing almond-shaped in animals with eyelids.
examples: my cat is blind in one eye
closing her eyes, she tried to relax

noun.description: A thing resembling an eye in appearance, shape, or relative position.
The small hole in a needle through which the thread is passed.

verb.description: Look at or watch closely or with interest.

phrases: all eyes are on the hot spots of eastern Europe
My wife, mortified, tried to square her shoulders as all eyes dropped to her chest.
He looked at the group of people sitting down and soon all eyes were focused on the ground.
Now, he's in the final again and no matter what the semi-final scores say, all eyes are on the Ashanti.
Whatever the explanation, we can see that all eyes are on Clooney.
origin: Old English ēage, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch oog and German Auge.
